instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
Hi All
I browsed through the forum and tried to follow a few threads with info pertaining to my repair.
820-00165 liquid damaged
Around SMC , Q7520,  and Q7180 cleaned up and replaced components didnt chance smc.
Replaced Q7560,C7583,C7581. Plugged dc supply in and pulls 30mah also found no PPBUS g3h found Q7180 bad replaced G3h is back.
Charger goes green to orange no fan.
So I have some number for anyone who will follow this. 
Ppbus g3h    8.6
Ppbus-s5-hs-comp  8.6
"                    "  other 8.6
Ppdcin-g3h     16.5
Pp3v42-g3h     3.42
Pprtc-g3h         3.3
Pp3v3-s5          3.3
Pp3v3-sosw-ssd  0
Pp5v-s5          5
Pp5s-s4rs3     0

Had to pick up kids can follow up with more info.
Thank you

I recommend to reball SMC, very probably soler balls affected by corrosion.

Do you get 3V3_SUS?
Post PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_RSMRST_L and PM_PWRBTN_L.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 66905, member: 682"]
I recommend to reball SMC, very probably soler balls affected by corrosion.

Do you get 3V3_SUS?
Post PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_RSMRST_L and PM_PWRBTN_L.
[/QUOTE]

Any reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above?
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...

I'm not sure what you mean.
But I think if I hit the reply icon it will quote the whole thing.  I apologize if I have  been.

3v3_sus                    0 volts
Bat_low                     3.35
Adaptor_en              3.43
Pm_Dsw_pwrgd       0
Pch_dswvrmen        3.26
Pm_rsmrst_l               0
Pm_pwrbtn_l            3.4
All these taken before smc reball
Thank you

"Pm_Dsw_pwrgd       0"
Do you stil have 3V3/5V_S5 present?
If yes, check R5192 and R8141.
If good, there is an SMC issue; did you reball it?
Thank you. Will follow up I think the customer just wants to replace it
